themes.name: Atmosphere
themes.description: Trace gases are produced and destructed by physical, biological and chemical processes. This natural cycle has been perturbed over the past decades by the global population increase and by the related boost of anthropogenic activities. The composition of the atmosphere is undergoing major and rapid changes with significant impacts on a global scale, affecting the environment and human health. Funding agencies and the scientific community have been putting enormous efforts into studying the impact of these changes. Nonetheless, there is still a need to fill knowledge gaps and enhance the understanding of precursors and the formation mechanisms of the different atmospheric compounds and the relative contribution of biogenic and anthropogenic sources and sinks to their global budget. Such knowledge improvements shall serve as input for policy makers in order to adopt mitigation and adaptation strategies.

variables.name: (13)CH4 delta
variables.description: 3D field of Delta C-13 in CH4 (Methane) (isotopic signature). Isotopic ratio, expressed as deviations from an agreed-upon international reference measurement standard (which defines the corresponding isotope scales) using the delta notation: δ = (Rsample/Rreference – 1), with R = [rare isotope]/[abundant isotope].

variables.name: (13)CO Delta
variables.description: 3D field of Delta C-13 in CO (Carbon monoxide) (isotopic signature)

variables.name: (13)CO2 Delta
variables.description: 3D field of Delta C-13 in CO2 (Carbon dioxide) (isotopic signature)

variables.name: (14)CH4 Delta
variables.description: 3D field of Delta C-14 in CH4 (Methane) (isotopic signature)

variables.name: (14)CO Number Concentration
variables.description: 3D field of amount of CO (Carbon monoxide) with C-14 isotope (mol) per air volume (m3)

variables.name: (14)CO2 Delta
variables.description: 3D field of Delta C-14 in CO2 (Carbon dioxide) (isotopic signature)

variables.name: Accumulated precipitation (over 24 h)
variables.description: Integration of precipitation rate reaching the ground over several time intervals. The reference requirement refers to integration over 24 h

variables.name: Aerosol Absorption Optical Depth
variables.description: Vertical column integral of spectral aerosol absorption coefficient: AAOD = exp(-K. Δz) where K is the absorption coefficient [km-1] and Δz the vertical path [km]

variables.name: Aerosol column burden
variables.description: 2D field of the column burden of condensed particles in the atmosphere

variables.name: Aerosol dust concentration
variables.description: 3-D field of concentration of dust or sand in the atmosphere

variables.name: Aerosol effective radius
variables.description: 3D field of mean aerosol particle size, defined as the ratio of the third and second moments of the number size distribution of aerosol particles.  Requested in the troposphere (assumed height: 12 km) and as columnar average.

variables.name: Aerosol Extinction Coefficient
variables.description: 3D field of spectral volumetric extinction cross-section of aerosol particles.

variables.name: Aerosol Layer Height
variables.description: Height of vertically localized aerosol layer in the free troposphere above sea level

variables.name: Aerosol mass mixing ratio
variables.description: 3D field of the mass mixing ratio of condensed particles in the atmosphere

variables.name: Aerosol Optical Depth
variables.description: The AOD is the effective depth of the aerosol column from the viewpoint of radiation propagation: Vertical column integral of spectral aerosol extinction coefficient AOD = exp(-K. Δz) where K is the extinction coefficient [km-1 ] and Δz the vertical path [km]

variables.name: Aerosol single-scattering albedo
variables.description: The spectrally dependent ratio of the aerosol scattering to the aerosol extinction

variables.name: Aerosol species mole fraction
variables.description: 3D field of the mole fraction of condensed-phase chemical species (e.g., sulfate, nitrate, ammonium, elemental carbon, organic carbon),  in the atmosphere

variables.name: Aerosol species total column burden
variables.description: 2D field integrated over the total column burden of concentration of condensed-phase chemical species (e.g., sulfate, nitrate, ammonium, elemental carbon, organic carbon), in the atmosphere

variables.name: Aerosol type
variables.description: Selection, out of a pre-defined set of aerosol classes, that best fits an input data set (observed or modeled). The pre-defined set of aerosol classes includes specification of the particle composition, mixing state, complex refractive index, and shape as a function of particle size. The definition of aerosol type includes specification of all the classes as well as the algorithm used to choose the best fit to the input data.

variables.name: Aerosol volcanic ash
variables.description: 3D field of mass mixing ratio of volcanic ash

variables.name: Aerosol volcanic ash  Total Column
variables.description: 2D Field of mass of volcanic ash, integrated over the total column.

variables.name: Air pressure (near surface)
variables.description: Air pressure at a known height above the surface with the height specified in the metadata

variables.name: Air specific humidity (near surface)
variables.description: Air specific humidity  at a known height  above surface, with the height specified in the metadata. Specific  humidity is the ratio of the mass of water vapour and the mass of moist air.

variables.name: Air temperature (near surface)
variables.description: Air temperature at a known height above the surface with the height specified in the metadata

variables.name: Atmospheric density
variables.description: 3D field of density of the atmosphere

variables.name: Atmospheric temperature
variables.description: 3D field of the atmospheric temperature

variables.name: Background Luminance (surface)
variables.description: Luminous flux received from the background, per unit solid angle and per unit area where the Luminous flux is a quantity derived from radiant flux by evaluating the radiation according to its action upon the International Commission on Illumination standard photometric observer. (symbol: L; unit: lm. m<sup>–2<sub>.</sub></sup> sr<sup>–1</sup> = cd . m<sup>–2</sup> )

variables.name: BrO
variables.description: 3D field of amount of BrO (Bromine monoxide, expressed in moles)   divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: C(17)OO Delta
variables.description: 3D field of Delta O-17 in CO2 (Carbon dioxide) (isotopic signature)

variables.name: C(18)O Delta
variables.description: 3D field of Delta O-18 in CO (Carbon monoxide) (isotopic signature)

variables.name: C(18)OO Delta
variables.description: 3D field of Delta O-18 in CO2 (Carbon dioxide) (isotopic signature)

variables.name: C10H16 (3-Carene) Mole Fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount  of C10H16 (3-Carene, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: C10H16 (alfapinene) Mole Fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount  of C10H16 (alfapinene,expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: C10H16 (betapinene) Mole Fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of C10H16 (betapinene, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: C10H16 (Limonene) Mole Fraction
variables.description: 3D field of dry air mole fraction of C10H16 (Limonene, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: C2H2
variables.description: 3D field of amount of C2H2 (Acetylene. expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: C2H5OH Mole Fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of C2H5OH (Ethanol, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: C2H6
variables.description: 3D field of amount of C2H6 (Ethane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: C2H6S Mole Fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of C2H6S (Dimethyl sulphide, DMS, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) .

variables.name: C3H6O Mole Fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount  of C3H6O (Acetone, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: C3H8
variables.description: 3D field of amount  of C3H8 (Propane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: C4H10
variables.description: 3D field of dry air mole fraction of C4H10 (Methylpropane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: C4H10 (n-butane)
variables.description: 3D field of amount dry of C4H10 (n-butane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: C5H12 (2-Methylbutane)
variables.description: 3D field of dry air mole fraction of C5H12 (2-Methylbutane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: C5H12 (n-Pentane)
variables.description: 3D field of amount of C5H12 (n-Pentane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: C5H8
variables.description: 3D field of amountof C5H8 (Isoprene,expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: C6H6
variables.description: 3D field of amount of C6H6 (Benzene, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: C7H8 Mole Fraction
variables.description: 3D field of dry air mole fraction of C7H8 (Toluene,expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: CFC-11
variables.description: 3D field of amount of CFC-11 (Trichlorofluoromethane = Freon-11,expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: CFC-12
variables.description: 3D field of amount of CFC-12 (Dichlorodifluoromethane = Freon-12, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) .

variables.name: CH3Br
variables.description: 3D field of amount of CH3Br (methil bromide, or bromomethane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: CH3CN Mole Fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of CH3CN (Acetonitrile, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: CH3D Delta
variables.description: 3D field of Delta Deuterium (H-2) in CH4 (Methane) (isotopic signature)

variables.name: CH3OH Mole Fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of CH3OH (Methanol, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: CH4 column average dry air mixing ratio
variables.description: 2D Column integrated number of molecules of the target gas (CH4, methane) divided by that of dry air expressed in mole fraction

variables.name: CH4 mole fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of CH4 (Methane, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: CH4 Mole fraction (BG)
variables.description: 3D field of amount of  background (BG) CH4 (Carbon Dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: CH4 Mole fraction (SR)
variables.description: 3D field of amount of  source region (SR) CH4 (Carbon Dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: CH4 Tropospheric column
variables.description: 2D field of total amount of CH4 molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.

variables.name: ClO
variables.description: 3D field of amount  of ClO (Chlorine monoxide = Hypochlorite, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: ClONO2
variables.description: 3D field of amount of ClONO2 (Chlorine nitrate, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: Cloud base height
variables.description: Height of the bottom surface of the cloud

variables.name: Cloud cover
variables.description: 3D field of fraction of sky filled by clouds.

variables.name: Cloud drop effective radius
variables.description: Size distribution of liquid water drops, assimilated to spheres of the same volume. Considered as both a 3D field throughout the troposphere and a 2D field at the top of cloud surface.

variables.name: Cloud ice
variables.description: 3D field of atmospheric water in the solid phase (precipitating or not).

variables.name: Cloud ice effective radius
variables.description: Size distribution of ice particles, assimilated to spheres of the same volume.  Considered as both a 3D field throughout the troposphere and a 2D field at the top of cloud surface

variables.name: Cloud ice Total Column
variables.description: 2D Field of atmospheric water in the solid phase (precipitating or not), integrated over the total column.

variables.name: Cloud liquid water (CLW)
variables.description: 3D field of atmospheric water in the liquid phase (precipitating or not).

variables.name: Cloud liquid water (CLW) total column
variables.description: 2D Field of atmospheric water in the liquid phase (precipitating or not), integrated over the total column.

variables.name: Cloud optical depth
variables.description: Effective depth of a cloud from the viewpoint of radiation extinction. OD = exp(-K.Δz) where K is the extinction coefficient [km-1 ], Δz the vertical path [km] between the base and the top of the cloud and the reference wavelength to be specified in the metadata.

variables.name: Cloud to Ground lightning density
variables.description: Number of detected cloud-to-ground flashes in the corresponding time interval and the space unit. The space unit (grid box) should be equal to the horizontal resolution and the accumulation time to the observing cycle

variables.name: Cloud top height
variables.description: Height of the top of the cloud (highest cloud in case of multi-layer clouds)

variables.name: Cloud top pressure
variables.description: Pressure at the top of the cloud

variables.name: Cloud top temperature
variables.description: Temperature of the top of the cloud (highest cloud in case of multi-layer clouds)

variables.name: Cloud type
variables.description: Result of cloud type classification - Accuracy expressed as inverse of number of classes, so that smaller figures correspond to better performance.

variables.name: CO mole fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of CO (Carbon monoxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: CO mole fraction (near surface)
variables.description: 2D field of amount of CO (Carbon monoxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) at a known height above surface, with the height specified in the metadata

variables.name: CO Total Column
variables.description: 2D field of total number of CO modelcues (Carbon Monixide) per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth's  surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere.

variables.name: CO Tropospheric column
variables.description: 2D field of total amount of CO molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.

variables.name: CO2 column average dry air mixing ratio
variables.description: 2D Column integrated number of molecules of the target gas (CO2, Carbon dioxide) divided by that of dry air expressed in mole fraction

variables.name: CO2 mole fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of CO2 (Carbon dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: CO2 Mole fraction (BG)
variables.description: 3D field of amount of  background (BG) CO2 (Carbon Dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: CO2 Mole fraction (SR)
variables.description: 3D field of amount of  source region (SR) CO2 (Carbon Dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: CO2 Tropospheric Column
variables.description: 2D field of total amount of CO2 molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.

variables.name: COS
variables.description: 3-D field of amount  of COS (Carbonyl sulfide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: Dew Point Temperature
variables.description: Temperature to which air must be cooled to become saturated with water vapor  at a known height  above surface, with the height specified in the metadata (K)

variables.name: DMS Mole Fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of DMS (Dimethyl sulfide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: Downward long-wave irradiance at Earth surface
variables.description: Flux density of radiation emitted by the gases, aerosols and clouds of the atmosphere to the Earth's surface

variables.name: Downward short-wave irradiance at Earth surface
variables.description: Flux density of the solar radiation at the Earth surface

variables.name: Downward short-wave irradiance at TOA
variables.description: Flux density of the solar radiation at the top of the atmosphere

variables.name: Earth surface albedo
variables.description: Hemispherically integrated reflectance of the Earth surface in the range 0.4-0.7

variables.name: Earth surface short-wave bidirectional reflectance
variables.description: Reflectance of the Earth surface as a function of the viewing angle and the illumination angle in the range 0.4-0.7 . The distribution of this variable is represented by the Bidirectional Reflectance Distribution Function (BRDF)

variables.name: Freezing level height in clouds
variables.description: Height of the atmospheric layer in cloud where liquid-solid states transform into each other

variables.name: Glyoxal Mole Fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of OCHCHO (Glyoxal, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: Glyoxal Tropospheric column
variables.description: 2D field of tropospheric column averaged of amount of Glyoxal (expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: H2 Mole Fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of H2 ( expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: H2O
variables.description: 3D field of amount of H2O (Water vapour intended as a chemical species relevant for atmospheric chemistry. expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: HCFC-22
variables.description: 3D field of amount of HCFC-22 (hydrochlorofluorocarbon-22, or R-22expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: HCHO mole fraction
variables.description: 2D field of amount of HCHO (Formaldehyde, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) at a known height above surface, with the height specified in the metadata

variables.name: HCHO Total Column
variables.description: 2D field of total amount of HCHO molecules (Formaldehyde)  per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere.

variables.name: HCHO Tropospheric column
variables.description: 2D field of total amount of HCHO molecules (Formaldehyde)  per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.

variables.name: HCl
variables.description: 3D field of amount of HCl (Hydrogen chloride, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: HD Delta
variables.description: 3D field of Delta Deuterium (H-2) in HD (molecular Hydrogen) (isotopic signature)

variables.name: HDO
variables.description: 3D field of amount  of HDO (Water vapour (with one hydrogen nucleus replaced by its deuterium isotope) , expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: Height of the top of PBL
variables.description: Height of the surface separating the PBL from the free atmosphere

variables.name: Height of the tropopause
variables.description: Height of the surface separating the troposphere from the stratosphere

variables.name: HNO3
variables.description: 3D field of amount of HNO3 (Nitric acid, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: Hydrometeor type
variables.description: 3D field of the predominant form of condensed water in a volume of free atmosphere, including liquid cloud, rain, ice crystals, snow, graupel and hail. (This variable replaces "precipitation type").

variables.name: Icing potential
variables.description: 3D field of super-cooled liquid water, enabling the formation of ice coating on an object.

variables.name: Integrated Water Vapour (IWV)
variables.description: Total amount of water vapour present in a vertical atmospheric column.

variables.name: Long-wave Earth surface emissivity
variables.description: Emissivity of the Earth surface in the thermal IR, function of the wavelength

variables.name: Melting layer depth in clouds
variables.description: Depth of the atmospheric layer in cloud where liquid-solid states transform into each other

variables.name: Meteorological Optical Range (MOR) (surface)
variables.description:
Length of path in the atmosphere required to reduce the luminous flux in a collimated beam from an incandescent lamp, at a colour temperature of 2 700 K, to 5 per cent of its original value, the luminous flux being evaluated by means of the photometric luminosity function of the International Commission on Illumination.  For aeronautical purposes, the surface MOR is measured at a height of 2.5 m above the surface. 
(Unit: m )

variables.name: N(15)NO Delta
variables.description: 3D field of Delta N-15 in N2O (Nitrous oxide) (isotopic signature)

variables.name: N(15)NO-Alpha Delta
variables.description: 3D field of Delta N-15 in Alpha-N2O (Nitrous oxide where the outer Nitrogen atom is N-15)  (isotopic signature)

variables.name: N(15)NO-Beta Delta
variables.description: 3D field of Delta N-15 in Beta-N2O (Nitrous oxide where the middle Nitrogen atom is N-15) (isotopic signature)

variables.name: N2(18)O Delta
variables.description: 3D field of Delta O-18 in N2O (Nitrous oxide) (isotopic signature)

variables.name: N2O mole fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount  of N2O (Nitrous oxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: N2O mole fraction (BG)
variables.description: 3D field of amount of  background (BG) N2O (Nitrous Oxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: N2O mole fraction (SR)
variables.description: 3D field of amount of  source region (SR) N2O (Nitrous Oxide,  expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: N2O5
variables.description: 3D field of amount of N2O5 (expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: NH3 Mole Fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of  NH3 (Ammonia, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: NH3 Total Column
variables.description: 2D field of total amount of NH3 molecules (Ammonia) per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere.

variables.name: NO
variables.description: 3D field of amount of NO expressed in moles divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: NO2  Total Column
variables.description: 2D field of total amount of NO2 molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere.

variables.name: NO2 Mole  fraction (SR)
variables.description: 3D field of amount of Source Region (SR) NO2 (expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: NO2 mole fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of NO2 (Nitrogen dioxide,  expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: NO2 Mole fraction (BG)
variables.description: 3D field of amount of  background (BG) NO2 (expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: NO2 mole fraction (near surface)
variables.description: 2D field of amount of NO2 (Nitrogen Dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) at a known height above surface, with the height specified in the metadata

variables.name: NO2 Stratospheric Column
variables.description: 2D field of total amount of NO2 molecules (Nitrogen Dioxide) per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the tropopause to the stratopause

variables.name: NO2 Tropospheric column
variables.description: 2D field of total amount of NO2 molecules ( Nitrogen Dioxide) per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.

variables.name: NO3 Mole Fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of NO3 (expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: O3
variables.description: 3D field of amount of O3 (Ozone, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: O3 mole fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of O3 (Ozone, expressed in moles) in the troposphere divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: O3 Stratospheric Column
variables.description: 2D field of total amount of O3 (ozone) molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from tropopause to stratopause

variables.name: O3 Total Column
variables.description: 2D field of total amount of O3 molecules per unit area  in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere (Dobson units).

variables.name: O3 Tropospheric Column
variables.description: 2D field of total amount of O3 (ozone) molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the to the tropopause

variables.name: OCS Mole fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of OCS (Carbonyl sulfide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: OH
variables.description: 3D field of amount of OH (Hydroxil radical, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: PAN
variables.description: 3D field of amount of PAN (Peroxy Acetyl Nitrate, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR)
variables.description: Flux of downwelling photons of wavelength 0.4-0.7

variables.name: Precipitation  (liquid or solid)
variables.description: 3D field of the vertical flux of precipitating water mass (precipitation intensity)

variables.name: Precipitation intensity at surface (liquid or solid)
variables.description: Intensity of precipitation reaching the ground - Physical unit: [ mm/h ] (if solid, mm/h of liquid water after melting) - Accuracy unit: [ mm/h ]. Since accuracy changes with intensity, it is necessary to specify a reference intensity. Assumed rate: 5 mm/h.

variables.name: Precipitation intensity at surface (solid)
variables.description: Intensity of solid precipitation reaching the ground - Physical unit: [ mm/h ] (mm of liquid water after melting)

variables.name: Precipitation type at the surface
variables.description: The type of precipitation reaching the surface, including snow, rain, hail, dew, rime, hoar frost and fog precipitation.

variables.name: PSC occurrence
variables.description: 3D field of Polar Stratospheric Clouds occurrence. - Accuracy expressed as Hit Rate [ HR ] and False Alarm Rate [ FAR ].  Simplified: [ FAR/HR]

variables.name: Radiation profile
variables.description: Vertical profile of upward and downward LW and SW radiation components

variables.name: Relative humidity
variables.description: 3D field of relative humidity in the atmosphere. Relative humidity is the ratio of the amount of atmospheric moisture present relative to the amount that would be present if the air were saturated with respct to water or ice to be specified in the metadata

variables.name: Relative Humidity (near surface)
variables.description: Relative  humidity  at a known height  above surface, with the height specified in the metadata.Relative humidity is the ratio of the amount of atmospheric moisture present relative to the amount that would be present if the air were saturated with respect to water or ice to be specified in the metadata

variables.name: SF6
variables.description: 3D field of amount  of SF6 (Sulfur hexafluoride,   expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles).

variables.name: Short-wave cloud reflectance
variables.description: Reflectance of the solar radiation from clouds

variables.name: SO2 mole fraction
variables.description: 3D field of amount of SO2 (Sulfur dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles)

variables.name: SO2 mole fraction (near surface)
variables.description: 2D field of amount of SO2 (Sulfur dioxide, expressed in moles) divided by the total amount of all constituents in dry air (also expressed in moles) at a known height above surface, with the height specified in the metadata

variables.name: SO2 Total Column
variables.description: 2D field of total amount of SO2 molecules (Sulfur dioxide) per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the upper edge of the atmosphere

variables.name: SO2 Tropospheric Column
variables.description: 2D field of total amount of SO2 molecules per unit area in an atmospheric column extending from the Earth’s surface to the tropopause.

variables.name: Solar spectral irradiance
variables.description: Total Solar Irradiance (TSI); when measured as a function of wavelength it is the spectral irradiance

variables.name: Specific humidity
variables.description: 3D field of the specific humidity in the atmosphere. The specific humidity is the ratio between the mass of water vapour and the mass of moist air.

variables.name: Temperature of the tropopause
variables.description: Atmospheric temperature at the height of the surface separating the troposphere from the stratosphere

variables.name: Total lightning density
variables.description: Total number of detected flashes in the corresponding time interval and the space unit. The space unit (grid box) should be equal to the horizontal resolution and the accumulation time to the observing cycle

variables.name: Turbulence
variables.description: 3D field of kinetic energy density of turbulent motion of the air

variables.name: Upward long-wave irradiance at Earth surface
variables.description: Flux density of terrestrial radiation emitted by the Earth surface

variables.name: Upward long-wave irradiance at TOA
variables.description: Flux density of terrestrial radiation emitted by the Earth surface and the gases, aerosols and clouds ot the atmosphere at the top of the atmosphere

variables.name: Upward short-wave irradiance at TOA
variables.description: Flux density of solar radiation, reflected by the Earth surface and atmosphere, emitted to space at the top of the atmosphere

variables.name: Upward spectral radiance at TOA
variables.description: Upward radiant power measured at the top of the atmosphere per area unit, per solid angle, and per wavelength interval. Spectral range 0.2-200 µm. Resolving power ?/??= 1000. Accuracy quoted as SNR (Signal-to-Noise-Ratio), actually SNR^-1 so that smaller figure means better performance, as usual.

variables.name: Wind (horizontal)
variables.description: 3D field of the horizontal vector component (2D) of the 3D wind vector. The acuracy is meant as vector error, i.e. the module of the vector difference between the observed vector and the true vector.

variables.name: Wind (vertical)
variables.description: 3D field of the vertical component of the 3D wind vector

variables.name: Wind direction (near surface)
variables.description: Direction from which wind is blowing at a known height above the surface which is to be specified in the metadata

variables.name: Wind speed (near surface)
variables.description: Speed of air at a known height above the surface which is to be specified in the metadata

variables.name: Wind vector (near surface)
variables.description: Horizontal wind vector, at a known height above the surface which is to be sprcified in the metadata

variables.name: Solar-induced chlorophyll fluorescence (SIF)
variables.description: Solar induced chlorophyll fluorescence (SIF) is an electromagnetic signal emitted by the chlorophyll a of assimilating plants: part of the energy absorbed by chlorophyll a is not used for photosynthesis, but emitted at longer wavelengths as a two-peak spectrum roughly covering the 650–850 nm spectral range. The SIF signal responds instantaneously to perturbations in environmental conditions such as light and water stress, which makes it a direct proxy for photosynthetic activity. However, SIF emission constitutes only a small fraction (typically 0.5%-2%) of the radiance at the top of the canopy, which is mostly composed of reflected sunlight, and its estimation from space-borne spectrometers requires both high spectral resolution and advanced retrieval schemes.

themes.name: Cryosphere
themes.description: Polar regions are undergoing major and drastic changes with significant impact at global scale. Addressing this unique set of global challenges will require more than ever that scientists advance their understanding of the different drivers governing changes in Polar regions, its associated processes and its potential impacts and translate that knowledge into solutions for society, policy advice and effective mitigation and adaptation strategies. This will require a significant collaborative effort and an integrated approach to science where the synergistic use of EO satellite data, in-situ and citizen observations, advanced modelling capabilities, interdisciplinary research and new technologies will be essential elements.

variables.name: Sea-ice cover
variables.description: Fraction of an ocean area where ice is present

variables.name: Sea-ice elevation
variables.description: Elevation of the surface of the sea-ice sheet above sea level

variables.name: Sea-ice motion
variables.description: Sea-ice motion

variables.name: Sea-ice surface characteristics
variables.description: Sea-ice surface characteristics (albedo, meltpond, dust, snow properties, temperature)

variables.name: Sea-ice surface temperature
variables.description: Temperature of the surface of sea-ice.

variables.name: Sea-ice thickness
variables.description: Thickness of the ice sheet. It is related to sea-ice elevation and ice density

variables.name: Sea-ice type
variables.description: Variable convolving several factors (age, roughness, density, etc.) - Accuracy expressed as number of classes. Actually [ classes^-1 ] is used, so that smaller figure corresponds to better performance, as usual.

themes.name: Land
themes.description: The carbon cycle is central to the Earth system, being inextricably coupled with climate, the water cycle, nutrient cycles and the production of biomass by photosynthesis on land and in the oceans. In the natural system the balance among carbon in the atmosphere, land and ocean is regulated through fluxes between these three main reservoirs. In addition to these natural components, there are the contributions to the atmosphere from human activities, namely, fossil fuel burning, cement production, and a range of land management practices. Over the past 250 years, the atmospheric carbon dioxide (CO2) concentration has increased by roughly 45% from its pre-industrial value of roughly 280 parts per million by volume (ppm). In the same timeframe, atmospheric methane (CH4), a greenhouse gas 28 times more powerful than CO2 has more than doubled due to human activities, responsible for approx. 60% of total emissions, and, after a hiatus, is rising faster than at any time in the last two decades. Understanding the patterns of exchanges of carbon between the atmosphere, ocean and land and the processes associated to them such as CO2 fertilization, ocean acidification, changes in surface runoff of sediments, changes to wetlands and peatlands, warming of permafrost, and changes to natural disturbance regimes, are critical to improving knowledge of the carbon cycle, its direct and indirect impacts on society and identifying approaches to mitigate and adapt for its consequences.

variables.name: Biomass
variables.description: Total amount of vegetation in a reference area - Physical unit: [ t/ha (tons/hectare) ] - Accuracy unit: [ t/ha ]

variables.name: CO2 flux
variables.description: Flux of carbon dioxide from the surface to the atmosphere

variables.name: Coastlines
variables.description: Location of coastlines  (Lat/Long)

variables.name: Evapotranspiration
variables.description:
Quantity of water evaporated from
the soil and plants when the ground is at its natural moisture content.

variables.name: Fire fractional cover
variables.description: Fraction of a land area where fire is occurring

variables.name: Fire radiative power
variables.description: Power radiated by the fire occurring within an area

variables.name: Fire temperature
variables.description: Temperature of the fire occurring within an area

variables.name: Fraction of Absorbed PAR (FAPAR)
variables.description: Fraction of PAR absorbed by vegetation (land or marine) for photosynthesis processes (generally around the 'red' )

variables.name: Fraction of vegetated land
variables.description: Fraction of a land area where vegetation is present

variables.name: Glacier cover
variables.description: Fraction of a land area covered by permanent ice

variables.name: Glacier motion
variables.description: Velocity of the ice measured at the surface of a glacier

variables.name: Glacier topography
variables.description: Map of the height of the glacier surface.

variables.name: Ground water
variables.description: Amount of water present beneath the ground surface per unit area

variables.name: Ice sheet topography
variables.description: Map of ice sheet height over land .

variables.name: Lake area
variables.description: Aera extent of the surface of a lake

variables.name: Lake level
variables.description: Map of the height of the lake surface.

variables.name: Lake Surface Temperature
variables.description: Temperature of the lake surface - Physical unit: [ K ] - Accuracy unit: [ K ].

variables.name: Land cover
variables.description: Processed from land surface imagery by assigning identified cluster(s) within a given area to specific classes of objects - Accuracy expressed as number of classes. Actually [ classes-1 ] is used, so that smaller figure corresponds to better performance, as usual.

variables.name: Land surface temperature
variables.description: Temperature of the apparent surface of land (bare soil or vegetation) - Physical unit: [ K ] - Accuracy unit: [ K ].

variables.name: Land surface topography
variables.description: Map of land surface heights - Physical unit: [ m ] - Accuracy unit: [ m ].

variables.name: Leaf Area Index (LAI)
variables.description: LAI is the total one-sided area of photosynthetic tissue per unit ground surface area

variables.name: Normalised Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI)
variables.description: Difference between maximum (in NIR) and minimum (around the Red) vegetation reflectance, normalised to the summation.  Representative of total biomass, supportive for computing LAI if not directly measured

variables.name: River discharge
variables.description: Volume of water flowing through a river per unit of time

variables.name: Snow cover
variables.description: Fraction of a given area which is covered by snow

variables.name: Snow depth
variables.description: Vertical distance from the snow surface to the underlying surface (ground, glacier ice or sea ice).

variables.name: Snow status (wet/dry)
variables.description: Binary product (dry or melting/thawing) expressing the presence of liquid water in a snow layer- Accuracy expressed as Hit Rate [ HR ] and False Alarm Rate [ FAR ].

variables.name: Snow water equivalent
variables.description: Vertical depth of the water that would be obtained by melting a snow layer.  Linked to snow depth through the density of the snow layer.

variables.name: Soil moisture  (in the roots region)
variables.description: Sub-soil 3D field of the fractional content of water in a volume of wet soil. Requested from surface down to ~ 3 m

variables.name: Soil moisture at surface
variables.description: Fractional content of water in a volume of wet soil. Surface layer (upper few centimetres)

variables.name: Soil temperature
variables.description: The standard depths for soil temperature measurements are 5, 10, 20, 50 and 100 cm below the surface; additional depths may be included. The site for such measurements should be a level plot of bare ground (about 75 cm^2 ) and typical of the surrounding soil for which information is required.

variables.name: Soil type
variables.description: Result of the classification of different types of soil within an area - Accuracy expressed as inverse of the number of classes, so that smaller figures correspond to better performance.

variables.name: Vegetation type
variables.description: Result of the classification of different types of vegetation within a vegetated area - Accuracy expressed as inverse of the number of classes, so that smaller figures correspond to better performance.

variables.name: Wetland extent
variables.description: Fraction of an area flood by water

variables.name: Wind gust
variables.description: Maximum value, over the observing cycle, of the 3-second running average wind speed

themes.name: Oceans
themes.description: Society is facing today a number of global environmental challenges requiring the better understanding and monitoring of the interconnected Earth System processes. Ocean is one key gearing of this complex engine. However, knowledge gaps remain in order to better understand, characterize and monitor its role in all major Earth System global cycles (e.g. water, energy, gas, and in particular carbon, momentum cycles…). To fill these gaps, dedicated research activities are needed, embracing a large number of disciplines as physical oceanography, biogeochemistry, ecology, and further exploring the interaction of the ocean with the other components of the Earth System, in particular the atmosphere, the land, and the cryosphere. To make the best of it, this research shall be based on the optimal and synergistic exploitation of all available observing systems (EO satellite data, in-situ and citizen observations), advanced modelling capabilities, interdisciplinary research and new technologies.

variables.name: Coastal sea level (tide)
variables.description: Deviation of sea level from local references in coastal zones, caused by local currents and tides (astronomical and wind-induced).

variables.name: Colour Dissolved Organic Matter (CDOM)
variables.description: Optically measurable component of the dissolved organic matter in water.

variables.name: Dissolved inorganic carbon  (DIC)
variables.description: The cumulated concentration of inorganic carbon species (dissolved carbon dioxide, carbonic acid, bicarbonate and carbonate) in solution.

variables.name: Dominant wave direction
variables.description: One feature of the ocean wave spectrum. It is the direction of the most energetic wave in the spectrum - Physical unit: [ degrees ] - Accuracy unit: [ degrees ].

variables.name: Dominant wave period
variables.description: The period of the most energetic wave in the ocean wave spectrum.

variables.name: Ocean chlorophyll concentration
variables.description: Indicator of living phytoplankton biomass, extracted from ocean colour observation. Uncertainty is expressed in mg/m3 for a given concentration of 1 mg/m3 .

variables.name: Ocean Diffuse Attenuation Coefficient (DAC)
variables.description: Indicator of water turbidity and vertical processes in the ocean, extracted from ocean colour observation.

variables.name: Ocean dynamic topography
variables.description: Deviation of sea level from the geoid caused by ocean currents (after corrections for tides and atmospheric pressure effects) - Physical unit: [ cm ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm ].

variables.name: Ocean salinity
variables.description: 3D field of salinity of the ocean  Requested in upper and deep ocean - Physical unit: [ psu ], Practical Salinity Unit, close to 1

variables.name: Ocean subsurface dissolved oxygen concentration
variables.description: Concentration of dissolved oxygen

variables.name: Ocean subsurface tracers
variables.description: Concentration of trace molecules such as tritium and CFCs

variables.name: Ocean surface currents (vector)
variables.description: Water flow on ocean surface - Physical unit: [ cm/s ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm/s ] intended as vector error, i.e. the module of the vector difference between the observed vector and the true vector.

variables.name: Ocean suspended sediments concentration
variables.description: Variable extracted from ocean colour observation. Indicative of river outflow, re-suspension or pollution of other-than-biological origin. Uncertainty expressed in g/m3 at a specific concentration (e.g., 2 g/m3 ).

variables.name: Ocean temperature
variables.description: 3D field of temperature of the ocean  Requested in upper and deep ocean.

variables.name: Ocean velocity
variables.description: Ocean motion measured at various depth levels.

variables.name: Oil spill cover
variables.description: Fraction of an ocean area polluted by hydrocarbons released from ships or off-shore platforms, accidentally or deliberately.

variables.name: pCO2
variables.description: Partial pressure of carbon dioxide at the surface of the sea

variables.name: pH
variables.description: The hydrogen ion concentration in seawater, which is a measure of acidity and alkalinity

variables.name: Sea surface heat flux
variables.description: Sea Surface Heat Flux

variables.name: Sea surface height anomaly
variables.description: Sea surface height anomaly

variables.name: Sea Surface Mass Flux
variables.description: Sea Surface Mass Flux

variables.name: Sea surface salinity
variables.description: Salinity of sea water in the surface layer (upper ~ 1 m if observed in MW).  In the open ocean the correct term should be  “halinity” with reference of the diversity of salts involved.

variables.name: Sea surface temperature
variables.description: Temperature of the sea water at surface.   The “bulk” temperature refers to the depth of typically 2 m, the “skin” temperature refers to within the upper 1 mm.

variables.name: Significant wave height
variables.description: Average amplitude of the highest 30 of 100 waves.

variables.name: Total alkalinity (AT)
variables.description: The amount of acid necessary to titrate all weak bases in seawater.

variables.name: Water-leaving spectral radiance
variables.description: Upward spectral radiance from the ocean surface, i.e. amount of light leaving the ocean per unit area, per wavelength and per solid angle.

variables.name: Wave 1D energy frequency spectrum
variables.description: 1D variable colloquially referred to as “wave spectrum”. Describes the wave energy in each frequency band (e.g. 25 frequency bands) regardless of the direction of propagation

variables.name: Wave directional energy frequency spectrum
variables.description: 2D variable colloquially referred to as wave spectrum. Describes the wave energy travelling in each direction and frequency band (e.g., 24 distinct azimuth sectors each 15° wide, and 25 frequency bands)

variables.name: Wind stress
variables.description: The shear force per unit area exerted by wind blowing over the sea surface -

themes.name: Magnetosphere_Ionosphere
themes.description: All magnetic objects produce invisible lines of force that extend between the poles of the object. Earth is similar to a giant bar magnet with magnetic field lines radiating from the south to the north magnetic pole. Charged particles become trapped on these field lines, forming the Earth's magnetosphere. However, Earth's magnetic field lines are not symmetric with respect to its magnetic axis, unlike those of a bar magnet. The impact of a continuous stream of solar particles (the solar wind) causes the lines facing the Sun to be compressed. The field lines facing away from the Sun get stretched and elongated, forming the Earth's magnetotail. The bullet shaped magnetic bubble formed by the terrestrial magnetic field lines is called the Earth's magnetosphere. The magnetosphere extends into the vacuum of space, on average, from approximately 60 000 kilometres sunward, and trails out more than 300 000 kilometres away from the Sun in the magnetotail.

variables.name: Alpha particles integral directional flux
variables.description: An alpha particle has positive charge and consists of two protons and two neutrons (the nucleus of a helium atom). Flux is the rate of flow through a reference surface, measured in particles per unit area.The directional flux is the flux limited to a certain solid angle as a function of the direction (pitch angle).

variables.name: Aurora
variables.description: Occurence of fluorescence of the upper atmosphere through ionization by energetic charged particles accelerated by the Earth's magnetic field.

variables.name: Cosmic ray neutron flux
variables.description: Flux of neutrons near the surface of Earth due to collisions in the atmosphere of cosmic rays impacting Earth atmosphere from the Sun and outer space.

variables.name: Cosmic ray neutron flux spectrum
variables.description: Flux density energy spectrum of neutrons from the Sun or as component of the cosmic radiation.

variables.name: Crustal motion (horizontal and vertical)
variables.description: Changes in time of the position and height of the Earth plates.  Indicative of the lithosphere dynamics, thus useful for earthquake prediction  - Physical unit: [ mm/y ] - Accuracy unit: [ mm/y ].

variables.name: Crustal plates positioning
variables.description: Basis for monitoring the evolution of the lithosphere dynamics - Physical unit: [ cm ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm ].

variables.name: Earth Rotation
variables.description: Rotation velocity of the Earth, determining the length of the day - Physical unit: [Rad/s] - Accuracy unit: [Arcsec/century].

variables.name: Electric Field
variables.description: Magnitude and direction of the Earth’s electric field

variables.name: Electron Density
variables.description: 3-D field of the electron density in the ionosphere

variables.name: Electron differential directional flux
variables.description: Flux density energy spectrum of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium, per unit solid angle

variables.name: Electron flux density
variables.description: Flux density of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium.

variables.name: Electron flux energy spectrum
variables.description: Flux density energy spectrum of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium.

variables.name: Electron integral directional flux
variables.description: Flux density of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium, per unit solid angle.

variables.name: Electrostatic charge
variables.description: Measurement of the electrostatic charge of a satellite accumulated because of the environmental situation.

variables.name: Energetic Neutral Atom (ENA)
variables.description: Neutral atoms resulting from the capture of free electrons by positively ionized nuclei of the solar wind.  Once neutralised, the particles are no longer deviated by the interplanetary magnetic field, and still move very fast, travelling in an exact straight line.

variables.name: EUV flux
variables.description: Radiative flux integrated over the EUV band.

variables.name: EUV flux spectrum
variables.description: Energy spectrum of the radiative flux measured in the EUV band.

variables.name: EUV sky image
variables.description: EUV image of the sky

variables.name: foEs
variables.description: The highest ordinary-wave frequency reflected back from a sporadic E layer and observed by an ionosonde.

variables.name: foF2
variables.description: Critical frequency of the F2 layer of the ionosphere. This critical frequency (f, in MHz) is associated with the electron density (Ne, in cm-3): f=9*10-3*sqrt(Ne).

variables.name: Gamma-ray flux
variables.description: Radiative flux integrated over the gamma-ray domain.

variables.name: Gamma-ray flux spectrum
variables.description: Energy spectrum of the radiative flux measured in the gamma-ray domain.

variables.name: Geoid
variables.description: Equipotential surface which would coincide exactly with the mean ocean surface of the Earth, if the oceans were in equilibrium, at rest, and extended through the continents (such as with very narrow channels) - Physical unit: [ cm ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm ].

variables.name: Geomagnetic field
variables.description: Magnitude and direction of the 3D magnetic field on the surface of Earth and within the magnetosphere (i.e., in low-Earth orbit and in geosynchronous orbit).

variables.name: h'F
variables.description: Virtual height of the bottom of the ionospheric F-layer.

variables.name: Heavy ion angular flux energy and mass spectrum
variables.description: Flux density energy and mass spectrum of heavy ions ranging from Helium to Iron, per unit solid angle

variables.name: Heavy ion differential directional flux
variables.description: Flux density of heavy ions (eavier than Helium) per unit solid angle

variables.name: Heavy ion flux energy and mass spectrum
variables.description: Flux density energy and mass spectrum of heavy ions ranging from Helium to Iron.

variables.name: Heavy ion integral directional flux
variables.description: Flux density of heavy ions ranging from Helium to Iron.

variables.name: Heliospheric image
variables.description: Image of the interplanetary space between the Sun and Earth

variables.name: hmF2
variables.description: Altitude of the peak density in the ionospheric F2 layer.

variables.name: Interplanetary magnetic field
variables.description: Vector magnetic field (3D) in the solar wind. The reference frame is Cartesian or Cylindrical with many different axis orientations. Important in Space Weather to monitor magnetic disturbances of the near earth environment.

variables.name: Ionospheric plasma density
variables.description: Total number of ionized particles in a volume unit of ionospheric plasma

variables.name: Ionospheric plasma velocity
variables.description: Velocity of bulk plasma or electrons (depending on measurement technique) as a function of altitude in the ionosphere.

variables.name: Ionospheric Radio Absorption
variables.description: Attenuation of a radio wave passing through the lower ionosphere.

variables.name: Ionospheric Scintillation
variables.description: Random fluctuations of radio waves resulting of small scale variations of the ionospheric electron density in space and time.

variables.name: Ionospheric Vertical Total Electron Content (VTEC)
variables.description: Number of electrons between two points.

variables.name: NIR/SWIR flux
variables.description: Integrated NIR/SWIR flux

variables.name: NIR/SWIR flux spectrum
variables.description: Energy spectrum of diffuse NIR/SWIR flux measured in space

variables.name: NIR/SWIR sky image
variables.description: NIR/SWIR image of the sky

variables.name: Proton differential directional flux
variables.description: Flux density energy spectrum of low-, medium-, and high-energy protons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium, per unit solid angle.

variables.name: Proton integral directional flux
variables.description: Flux density of low-, medium-, and high-energy protons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium.

variables.name: Radiation Dose Rate
variables.description: 3D field of the dose rate of energetic particles

variables.name: Radio-waves
variables.description: Travelling radio-waves of solar, galactic and extragalactic origin, entering the Earth’s environment.

variables.name: Solar Ca II-K image
variables.description: Image of the Sun in the K-line of Ca-II  (393.4 nm)

variables.name: Solar coronagraphic image
variables.description: Image of the solar corona surrounding the Sun.

variables.name: Solar electric field
variables.description: Map of magnitude and direction of the electric field at the solar surface (photosphere).

variables.name: Solar EUV flux
variables.description: Integrated EUV flux over the solar disk

variables.name: Solar EUV flux spectrum
variables.description: Energy spectrum of the EUV flux integrated over the solar disk.

variables.name: Solar EUV image
variables.description: Images of the Sun in the Extreme Ultra-Violet (EUV) wavelengths in order to identify features such as filaments, active regions and coronal holes.

variables.name: Solar gamma-ray flux
variables.description: Integrated gamma-ray flux over the solar disk

variables.name: Solar gamma-ray flux spectrum
variables.description: Energy spectrum of the gamma-ray flux integrated over the solar disk

variables.name: Solar H-alpha image
variables.description: Image of the Sun in the Hydrogen-alpha transition wavelength (656.3 nm).

variables.name: Solar Lyman-alpha flux
variables.description: Solar flux in the Hydrogen Lyman-alpha transition wavelength (121.6 nm)

variables.name: Solar Lyman-alpha image
variables.description: Image of the Sun in the Hydrogen Lyman-alpha transition wavelength (121.6 nm)

variables.name: Solar magnetic field
variables.description: Vector magnetic field (1D or 3D) at the solar surface (photosphere/chromosphere)

variables.name: Solar radio flux
variables.description: Integrated radio flux over the solar disk.

variables.name: Solar radio flux spectrum
variables.description: Solar radio flux energy spectrum integrated over the solar disk.

variables.name: Solar radio image
variables.description: 2D image of the solar radio flux

variables.name: Solar UV flux
variables.description: Integrated UV flux over the solar disk.

variables.name: Solar UV flux spectrum
variables.description: Energy spectrum of the UV flux integrated over the solar disk.

variables.name: Solar UV image
variables.description: Images of the Sun in the UV wavelengths.

variables.name: Solar velocity fields
variables.description: Map of 3D velocity of particles of the Solar atmosphere, significant of the Sun interior.

variables.name: Solar VIS flux
variables.description: Integrated VIS flux over the solar disk

variables.name: Solar VIS flux spectrum
variables.description: Energy spectrum of the integrated VIS flux over the solar disk.

variables.name: Solar VIS image
variables.description: Images of the Sun in the VIS wavelengths.

variables.name: Solar white light image
variables.description: Image of the Sun in white light

variables.name: Solar wind density
variables.description: Density of solar wind plasma

variables.name: Solar wind temperature
variables.description: Temperature of solar wind protons

variables.name: Solar wind velocity
variables.description: Vector velocity of solar wind plasma

variables.name: Solar X-ray flux
variables.description: Integrated X-ray flux over the solar disk

variables.name: Solar X-ray flux spectrum
variables.description: Energy spectrum of the X-ray flux integrated over the solar disk.

variables.name: Solar X-ray image
variables.description: Image of the Sun in X-ray wavelengths

variables.name: Spread F
variables.description: Vertical thickness of highly structured ion density in the F-region of the ionosphere.

variables.name: UV flux
variables.description: Integrated UV flux.

variables.name: UV flux spectrum
variables.description: Energy spectrum of diffuse UV flux measured in space.

variables.name: UV sky image
variables.description: UV image of the sky

variables.name: VIS flux
variables.description: Integrated VIS flux

variables.name: VIS flux spectrum
variables.description: Energy spectrum of diffuse VIS flux measured in space

variables.name: VIS sky image
variables.description: VIS image of the sky

variables.name: X-ray flux
variables.description: Integrated X-ray flux.

variables.name: X-ray flux spectrum
variables.description: Energy spectrum of the integrated X-ray flux.

variables.name: X-ray sky image
variables.description: X-ray image of the sky

themes.name: Solid Earth
themes.description: Solid Earth refers to the crust, mantle and core. Because these parts of our world are completely hidden from view, understanding what is going on deep below our feet can only be done by using indirect measurements. A thorough understanding of the ‘solid Earth’ system is essential for deciphering the links between processes occurring deep inside Earth and those occurring nearer the surface that lead to seismic activity such as earthquakes and volcanic eruptions, the rise of mountains and the location of underground natural resources.

variables.name: Gravity field
variables.description: Indicative of the statics and dynamics of the lithosphere and the mantle - Physical unit: [ mGal ] where : 1 Gal = 0.01 m.s-2

variables.name: Gravity gradients
variables.description: Gradient of the Earth’s gravity field measured at the satellite orbital height - Physical unit: [ E ] , Eötvös (1 E = 1 mGal / 10 km) - Accuracy unit: [ E ].

variables.name: Geothermal energy
variables.description: Geothermal energy is heat derived from Earth's interior. Resources include hot springs and wells, hot dry rock, and even molten rock. These may be converted into heat and electricity.
